reviews.review_msg: One of the most frustrating classes I have ever taken!Graded on 3 things, an in-class dissertation, a group presentation and a final paper worth 50%! He knows a lot about Quebec litterature but doesn't seem interested in helping his students at all, takes 7+ weeks to grade anything, is unclear with his instructions and gives little to no feedback !

I did not enjoy my time in Jorges class. It is true he is knowledgeable in regards to the literature he lectures on. However, he is not very personable, does not hand assignments back in a timely manner, and gives almost no feedback on assignments. In addition, his marking is all over the place. I definitely would not take again.

Doesn't hand back your work, doesn't apologise when he says he'll do something, and then doesn't do it, makes one assignment worth over 50% of your mark, doesn't clearly answer questions related to assignments, takes upwards of 9 weeks to mark one assignment.

Pros: Very knowledgeable about Quebec culture, history, and literature. Cons: Follows text very closely and tests on small details (he says he'll test on general themes - don't believe him, he tests on specifics). 1000 word paper worth 50%. Takes ages to grade assignments. Other: Attendance and detailed note-taking are necessary.

I really like Christina. All of the readings were a 10/10. It was the only French class to not force us to use Zoom, and the only French professor I had that reached out to students about different possibilities of format for the class. Her course was also very well structured  well adapted for online teaching.
Interesting subjects and challenging. It would have been great if we received readings for the next week, but she is a fair maker.
I took her course last year, really liked her teaching, fantastic attitude. I wish 340 wasnt online. Youre gr8!

The texts chosen for this class were clearly chosen from a place of love, and if you too love queer feminist literature you need to take this class. His expectations for the writing assignments are quite high, as far as structure goes, but he gives ample time, so definitely take advantage of office hours! Give this man an award.

Very kind-hearted person. Class near-identical to FREN245 structure-wise (not Jorge woo!). As a trans person, way too much of the material is queer-focused and now boring. You can do well on the other 90% of the class (1800 words total lol) without attending at all, making worrying about participation not really necessary for a good B to B+ grade.

He is such a sweet person, is always available, and provides feedback to students when asked. If you are into Qu√©becois literature and theatre pieces, then take this course. Unfortunately for me, I was not a fan. I also wasn't not a fan of his assignments too, which were basically the same ones in 245, but longer and his marking was more critical.
